name: Pin Config & States
format:
Pin States

  1. {{msg.payload.pins["0"]}}
  2. {{msg.payload.pins["1"]}}
  3. {{msg.payload.pins["2"]}}
  4. {{msg.payload.pins["3"]}}
  5. {{msg.payload.pins["4"]}}
  6. {{msg.payload.pins["5"]}}
  7. {{msg.payload.pins["6"]}}
  8. {{msg.payload.pins["7"]}}
  9. {{msg.payload.pins["8"]}}
  10. {{msg.payload.pins["9"]}}
  11. {{msg.payload.pins["10"]}}

Pin States Legend

gpio docs

m (modes)

  1. gpio.INPUT
  2. gpio.OUTPUT
  3. gpio.INT
  4. gpio.OPENDRAIN

r (read state)

  1. LOW
  2. HIGH

w (write state)

  1. LOW
  2. HIGH

pu (pullup)

  1. FLOAT(0) true
  2. PULLUP(1) false

pullup gpio.PULLUP enables the weak pull-up resistor;

default is gpio.FLOAT

t (trigger type)

  • "up"
  • "down"
  • "both"
  • "low"
  • "high"

pwm (pulse width modulation)

  • ON: "true"
  • OFF: "false"

freq (frequency for pwm pin)

  • INT
  • pwm frequency (0 - 1000 Hz)

duty (duty cycle for pwm pin)

  • INT
  • duty cycle (0-1024)

name: Device Configuration
format:
Device Configuration

  1. {{msg.payload[0]}}
  2. D (Device) Object
    1. dbg: {{msg.payload[1].dbg}}
    2. tmpr: {{msg.payload[1].tmpr}}
    3. s_io: {{msg.payload[1].s_io}}
    4. mqtt: {{msg.payload[1].mqtt}}
    5. heap_min: {{msg.payload[1].heap_min}}
    6. flashid: {{msg.payload[1].flashid}}
    7. flashsize: {{msg.payload[1].flashsize}}
    8. heap: {{msg.payload[1].heap}}
    9. pins: {{msg.payload[1].pins}}
    10. chipid: {{msg.payload[1].chipid}}
    11. ID: {{msg.payload[1].ID}}
    12. LED: {{msg.payload[1].LED}}
    13. t_cal: {{msg.payload[1].t_cal}}
    14. name: {{msg.payload[1].name}}
    15. ap_mac: {{msg.payload[1].ap_mac}}
    16. bootreason_extnd: {{msg.payload[1].bootreason_extnd}}
    17. ip: {{msg.payload[1].ip}}
    18. sta_mac: {{msg.payload[1].sta_mac}}
    19. type: {{msg.payload[1].type}}
